page.title: 08FARMING,MANAGEMENT OF SHEEP
page.content: The ewe lambs are moved to lowland or coastal pastures for the duration of the winter. This pratice of trans- humance is locally known as "tacking". The preferred localities for these sheep to winter are in West Wales and some farms have had the same arrange- mnts in force for many decades. The breeding ewes winter on the farms and are brought down to the lower fields for lambing. Because of the cold, wet winter and early spring, lambing only starts in late-March and continues through April. Most of the farms adjoining Fforest Fach have grazing rights upon the hill. This is not strictly common land as elsewhere, but the size of flocks grazing there means that edible plants are always cropped short. Lack of any improvemen of the land accounts for the plant communities found there.
